```kotlin
if(vadapter.itemCount == binding.viewPager.currentItem) {
 binding.nextbutton.text = "Get Started"

```

### Why it doesn't work:
- The `ViewPager.currentItem` is **zero-based** (starts at 0).
- `vadapter.itemCount` is the **total count** (starts at 1).
- So the **last page** will have an index of `vadapter.itemCount - 1`.

### Correct way to check for last page:
You should change your check to:

```kotlin
if(binding.viewPager.currentItem == vadapter.itemCount - 1) {
 binding.nextbutton.text = "Get Started"
} else {
 binding.nextbutton.text = "Next"
}
```

This way, when you're on the last page, the button text changes. You may want to also handle the button text on initial load and on page change, not just when the button is clicked.
